introducao: Bem-vindo à Lesson 4. Hoje você vai aprender sobre posições, números, quantidades e o uso de there is e there are.

Lesson4.text: between
Significa 'entre'. É usado para indicar algo no meio de dois elementos.
Which letter’s between D and F? E’s between D and F.
Which letter’s between H and J? I’s between H and J.
Which letter’s between Q and S? R’s between Q and S.
Vamos continuar.
us
‘Us’ significa 'nós' como objeto da frase. Veja os exemplos.
Where’s the table? The table’s in front of us.
Are the walls in front of us? No, they’re behind us.
Is the table behind us? No, it isn’t; it’s in front of us.
Próxima parte.
them
‘Them’ significa 'eles' ou 'elas' como objeto. Vamos ver.
Where’s the house? The house’s behind them.
Are you behind them? No, I’m in front of them.
Am I in front of them? No, you aren’t; you’re behind them.
Seguindo.
student and teacher
‘Student’ significa estudante e ‘teacher’ significa professor.
Am I a student? No, you aren’t; you’re the teacher.
Are you the teacher? No, I’m not; I’m a student.
Is he a teacher? Yes, he’s a teacher.
Muito bem, vamos adiante.
numbers from thirty to million
Agora vamos estudar números maiores, de 30 até um milhão.
Thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty, ninety, one hundred.
One thousand, one million.
What number’s this? It’s 1,815.
Próxima parte.
plus and equals
‘Plus’ significa somar e ‘equals’ significa igual. Vamos praticar.
What’s this? It’s two plus two equals four.
How much is thirteen plus five? Thirteen plus five equals eighteen.
How much is sixteen plus thirty? Sixteen plus thirty equals forty-six.
Seguindo.
there is / there’s
Usamos 'there is' para indicar que algo existe no singular.
Is there a pen on this book? Yes, there’s a pen on this book.
Is there a light on the ceiling? Yes, there’s a light on the ceiling.
Is there a bag in this room? Yes, there’s a bag in this room.
Próxima expressão.
there are / now
Usamos 'there are' para o plural. 'Now' significa agora.
Are there two pens on the book now? Yes, there are two pens on the book now.
Are there twelve chairs in this room? Yes, there are twelve chairs in this room.
Are there pictures on these walls? Yes, there are pictures on these walls.
Vamos adiante.
there isn’t
Forma negativa de 'there is'. Significa 'não há' ou 'não existe'.
Is there a pen on the book? No, there isn’t a pen on the book.
Is there a book on the floor? No, there isn’t a book on the floor.
Is there a clock on the table? No, there isn’t a clock on the table.
Próxima forma.
there aren’t
Forma negativa de 'there are'. Significa 'não há' no plural.
Are there three clocks on that wall? No, there aren’t three clocks; there’s one clock on that wall.
Are there a hundred pictures in this room? No, there aren’t a hundred pictures; there are a few pictures.
Are there a thousand chairs in this room? No, there aren’t a thousand chairs; there are ten chairs.
Continuando.
high and low
‘High’ significa alto e ‘low’ significa baixo.
Is the chair high? No, the chair isn’t high; it’s low.
Is the wall low? No, the wall isn’t low; it’s high.
Is the table high? No, the table isn’t high; it’s low.
Parabéns! Você concluiu a Lesson 4.
